pageHeader.text:
Big small business stories

Almost 5 million small business owners around the world rely on our brands to fuel their online presence and connect them with customers everywhere. They’re the mom-and-pop shops, home businesses, and start-ups that drive our economy. And they drive us, too.

customerStories.title: Powering passion projects
customerStories.customerStoryText:
Stella Scaramangos is the creator of TheWholeScoopBlog.com - a website that promotes healthy living via plant-based recipes, reviews, and more. While Stella's motivation to start a blog came from her children and passion for delicious healthy food, her confidence to create a site on her own came from using our Constant Contact intelligent website builder.

How we helped

As a successful food blogger, Stella needs her website to have consistent uptime, be simple to edit and look beautiful - all of which we’ve made possible with Constant Contact's A.I. powered website builder and reliable support. No tech skills or guesswork required. Now that Stella's had a small taste of what our platform can do, she's eager to dig in and try more.

customerStories.title: Spreading the word
customerStories.customerStoryText:
Owner of Catalano Architects, Tom comes from an entrepreneurial background and always knew that he wanted to work for himself. After successfully setting up his own firm, the next step in ensuring success was to make sure he was able to spread the word and build awareness about his business with prospective clients and partners.

How we helped

Constant Contact’s email marketing tools make it easy to stand out while you get the word out. Tom now relies on our tools to reach the audience his business needs, keep his name out there, and let his partners know about the exciting projects his firm is undertaking.

customerStories.title: Fashionably successful online
customerStories.customerStoryText:
Marissa Tilley knows formalwear. After spending the better part of her twenties walking in dozens of couture fashion shows, Marissa took the leap from the runway to run her own business. In the first month, she sold only 8 gowns. Marissa now ships over 1000 dresses each month since evolving her business model from a small offline shop to mostly online sales.

How we helped

Constant Contact’s email marketing tools make it easy to stand out while you get the word out. Tom now relies on our tools to reach the audience his business needs, keep his name out there, and let his partners know about the exciting projects his firm is undertaking.

customerStories.title: Making websites easy as pie
customerStories.customerStoryText:
Like most small business owners, Hedy Jarras was too busy running her business to deal with an outdated website. And while pushing this issue to the backburner worked fine for her for quite some time, the coronavirus pandemic changed that. Hedy needed a fresh, vibrant website that was easy to navigate, that she could quickly update on her own. The problem was, she didn’t know exactly how she was going to get that. Enter Constant Contact.

How we helped

By working with Constant Contact, Hedy got the website she needed, when she needed it. Now she has a completely new website that she, and her employees, can be proud of — a website that checks all of the ‘smarter choice’ boxes. And as part of the website redesign package, we also created an on-brand email template that Hedy can use for all of her email marketing campaigns.

customerStories.title: Trusted WordPress partners
customerStories.customerStoryText:
When Amber Knowles decided to quit her 9 to 5 job and turn her photography side-hustle into a full-blown business, she first needed to create a website that would showcase her approach to photography. As a multicultural wedding photographer, Amber takes great pride in photographing and editing in a way that skin tones and colors are true to life. The result is vibrant images that have been showcased in a number of recognized magazines and publications.

How we helped

Thanks to its unique partnership with Bluehost, Amber was able to teach herself web design using WordPress, and contact support whenever she needed – enabling her to create a sleek and easy to navigate website to showcase her business and help her stand out in the competitive photography industry.

customerStories.title: A website fit for Dog Fit Dallas
customerStories.customerStoryText:
Art owns and operates Dog Fit Dallas – a small business offering dog walking, training, and boarding services. Going beyond traditional obedience training, Art’s business provides people with the opportunity to connect with their dogs on a deeper level – combining education and wellness for dogs and owners through specialized lessons. And thanks to a great website, Art is able to connect with more customers and their furry companions.

How we helped

Through Bluehost, Art was able to get his pawtastic business up and running smoothly online, with the ease, functionality and support needed to keep it up-to-date. By going online, Art has been able to share his unique approach with a wider audience, and build relationships with new clients. When Covid-19 hit, Bluehost helped Art use the downtime to create a brand new website, fit for the new world.

customerStories.title: Sweet and simple hosting
customerStories.customerStoryText:
A homesteader in rural New England with a focus on all things sweet and simple, Michelle Visser needed a way to share her wonderful content and products with audiences both near and far. Through her blog, Michelle has built a loyal following and community of customers eager to be kept up-to-date with her latest offers.

How we helped

Michelle’s blog is hosted on HostGator – it’s there that she promotes her podcasts, publishes content and provides affiliate links. Through HostGator, we’ve provided Michelle with an easily customizable and always reliable way for readers and customers to discover her blog and enjoy her bountiful business.

customerStories.title: Hassle-free help
customerStories.customerStoryText:
As the owner of Cambridge-based small business, BreadPots, Judy needed to keep her hands free and energy focused on teaching her customers how to create beautiful bread pots – not worrying about keeping her website up and running. With a full schedule of creating art, running workshops and sharing products with customers, Judy has little time to spend on maintaining her website so she needed help to keep things running smoothly.

How we helped

Through iPage, we’ve made it possible for Judy to focus on what matters – her business, safe in the knowledge that her website is stable and secure. She can quickly and easily get any updates done without interference in her day-to-day.
